Transcript:
Olivia: My baby. What have
you done to my baby? Oh, Emma.
Buzz: What happened?

Olivia: She swallowed a bottle of perfume. I
found the bottle at the bottom of her bed.
Buzz: I'll get the car.

Ava: Um... oh, my God. I showed Emma the perfume. She must have grabbed it out of my bag.
Okay, we need to get down stairs.

Olivia: (Screams)
Get away from her!
(Knock on the door)
Mallet: It's open.

Gus: You rang? Oh, my God. Are you at this
again?

Mallet: What, did you think I was going to give up? I'm not giving up. There's a reason
Jeffrey is Dinah’s new best
friend.
Gus: Sure. When the trailer's a rockin', don't come a knockin'.

Mallet: I told you it's not about sex, okay?
She's holding something over his head. She's got something on him. I mean,
that's the reason he protected her after the fire.

Gus: You keep poking around,
you're going to be visiting your girlfriend in state prison.

Mallet: That's what I'm talking about. She
may already be in trouble. Man, what are you hiding, O’Neill?
And what do you want with my girl?
Jeffrey: Started without me, huh?
Dinah: It's a bar.
Jeffrey: Did you see Alan-Michael?

Dinah: He looks good. I held up my end of
the bargain and am getting you the Spaulding
endorsement.

Jeffrey: And I'm holding up my end of the
bargain: You're not in jail.
Dinah: You still have evidence against me?

Jeffrey: Yeah, well, I think I'm going to
hold onto that for a little while.
Dinah: Oh, I'm sure you will.
Jeffrey: Everything's going to be fine.
Dinah: Oh, really? You want to tell that to Mallet?

Jeffrey: Why don't you just go back to him?
We both know you want to.

Dinah: Well, I would, but he doesn't trust
me. And I'm very happy where I'm at. Sir, can I get another, please.
Alan: Beth?

Beth: Alan. You're baby shopping again? What
else can you possibly find to buy?

Alan: Well, I find things here and there.
Besides, I'm having a lot of fun doing it.

Beth: I can see that. You seem to be in a
good mood.

Alan: Well, I am. My wife and I are together
again, and we have the same goal.
Beth: Does that mean my plan is underway?

Alan: Yes, your plan is under way. Elizabeth
is on her way home, so she and the baby will be where they belong very shortly.

Beth: And all I have to do is make my
daughter seem crazy.

Alan: Seem crazy, but she's not. Beth, it
has all been worth it. Loading the gun with blanks, putting the bars on the
nursery...
Beth: You did all of that?

Alan: Yes, I did that to save Lizzie from a life with Randall,
and I have no regrets.
Beth: No regrets?
Tammy: What's going on?

Jonathan: Nothing to worry about. We're
celebrating tonight. You and I are engaged, and Lizzie’s
not going to be charged with shooting at Alan.
Tammy: So why doesn't anyone look happy?
Lizzie: Tammy...
Tammy: What? What's up? What's that?
Jonathan: Something stupid Alan’s done.

Tammy: He's trying to prove that you're an
unfit mother?
Jonathan: It's just a scare tactic.
Lizzie: It's working.
Jonathan: Well don't let it get to you.
Lizzie: Get to me? What's it called, a protective custody? Do you know what that means, Tammy?

Tammy: That means they're trying to take
action to keep the baby safe.

Lizzie: It means that they can lock me up as
long as I'm pregnant. It means they can go after the baby once it's born.

Jonathan: No, no, we're not going to go
there. Tonight was supposed to be a good night, and Alan
is not going to ruin it. Lizzie, you're going to be safe. Tammy, you and I are
still getting married.

Lizzie: No. No, you guys can't do that. I'm
not stupid, Tammy. I get that you guys are in love,
but what happens to me if you get married?
Jonathan: It has nothing to do with you.

Lizzie: Did you read those papers? They're
trying to prove I'm in a bad place with my baby. If you're married, I'm all
alone.

Jonathan: We're not going to kick you to the
curb.

Tammy: We're in this together. That hasn't
changed.
Lizzie: So you guys will help me fight my granddad?
Jonathan: Have we let you down so far?

Lizzie: No. I'm just scared, okay? When he
wants something, he goes after it. He wants our baby.

Jonathan: Well, he's not going to get her.
Okay.
Lizzie: Do you really mean that? Really?

Jonathan: Yes, yes. Alan is not going to
come anywhere near you or our baby.

Gus: I don't think that guy will be voting
for Jeffrey O’Neill.
Mallet: Gee, you think?
Gus: Maybe Jeffrey O’Neill slept with his daughter or something.
Mallet: Maybe.
Gus: Well, you got any other theories?
Mallet: What's that guy look like to you?
Gus: What, you think he looks like a fed?
Mallet: Don't you? Make the call.
Jeffrey: How many of those have you had?

Dinah: Not enough. Hello, gentlemen. I'm Dinah. And that is Mr. O’Neill over there, and he is running for mayor, and he
needs your vote.
Man: And just who are you, Dinah, his campaign manager?

Dinah: Well, you could say that, something
like that. I actually think it's my job now to spread the word about Mr. O’Neill. How do you think I'm
doing at spreading the word?
Man: Just fine, I'd say.
Dinah: So can Mr. O’Neill count on your support in the upcoming election?
Man: Sure, why not?
Man: I happen to like Blake Marler.
Man: Because you saw her on that web site. (Laughs)
Dinah: Where do you guys work?
Man: Lewis Oil, executive training program.

Dinah: Oh, executive training program.
That's good. Lewis is top-notch. Lean, but top-notch.
I can say that because I'm V.P. at Spaulding. (Laughs) We actually have more
perks than you guys do. We give a country club membership to our employees. You
guys golf, right? Of course. (Laughs) Everybody golf’s. Well, you know, we
have a lot more where that came from. If I can do anything to help you, I can
certainly hook you up-- if that's what you want, I
mean.
Man: Come on, give her what she wants.
Man: I'm listening.

Dinah: See, I knew you were smart.
Bartender, let me get a round of Alabama slammers for
my friends.

Gus: Nick, bro, you are the man. Thanks. A lucky hunch. Our mystery man is an associate director and
he's semi-retired, and his clearance is way out of my league. But you're never
going to guess who's an agent under him. --Who was an agent under him.

Mallet: How do we find Mr.
Former Director man?
Gus: Oh, I already did.

Rick: Hey, honey, it's just me. Listen, I
thought you were on shift today, and Charles told me
you had the shift changed. I was just wondering what... hey, what happened?

Olivia: She drank a bottle of perfume. She's
not waking up.

Rick: All right, Jenny, let's get her in the
exam room right away.
Olivia: Why isn't she waking up, Rick?
Rick: How much did she drink?
Olivia: I don't know.

Ava: I don't um... it was about half full,
the bottle.

Rick: Do you know how long ago she ingested
it?
Ava: Maybe about an hour ago. Maybe.
Olivia: How can you not know? Maybe!

Ava: It was after um... it was when Coop
left. It wasn't that long ago.

Rick: All right, everyone please go in the
waiting room, right away.
Olivia: No. No!
Rick: Just for a few minutes, Olivia, please. Just for a few minutes.

Olivia: She's got to be okay. She's got to
be okay.
Coop: My dad called me to come over. What’s...

Ava: It was all my
fault. It was all my fault. (Sobbing)

Jonathan: Okay, Mel
should be down in a minute to tell us that this is all trash and Alan doesn't have a case.

Lizzie: Did they say when she would be
finished?
Tammy: Soon.
Lizzie: Okay.
Jonathan: What?

Lizzie: It's just granddad has so many
lawyers. These guys got him freed when he shot my father.
Jonathan: Lizzie, it's going to be fine.
Woman: You can't lock me away. I have kids!
Officer: Come on.
Tammy: Lizzie, that's not going to be you.

Lizzie: I just-- I have to be alone for a
minute.
Jonathan: Lizzie...

Lizzie: No, I'm fine, okay. I just need to
think.

Tammy: There's always something else, isn't
there?

Jonathan: Hey, we'll beat
it, just like we beat everything.
Tammy: You could lose your kid?

Jonathan: No, I'm not going to lose my kid,
and I'm not going to lose you. Come on.

Olivia: She’s not moving. Is
she breathing? I can't tell if she's breathing. What? I can’t...
Buzz.
Buzz: Do you trust me?
Olivia: More than anyone.

Buzz: She's going to be all right. Believe
that. Okay?

Ava: Coop, I didn't mean to do anything to
hurt her.

Coop: I know that. Everybody knows that.
She's going to be okay. She's going to be okay.

Rick: She's stable. We had to pump her
stomach. And, unfortunately, she had an allergic reaction to that, so we put
her on I.V. Right now I'm just waiting for the blood work to get back to see
what the toxicity level is.
Olivia: Is she awake?
Rick: Not yet.
Olivia: Can I go see her?

Rick: When she's ready. She's not ready
right now, okay? She's going to be okay.

Ava: Olivia, I heard what Dr. Bauer said,
and I'm so sorry.

Olivia: You're sorry?! You're sorry?! Look,
I know that you hate me. I know you think I left you to die in that fire. But
come on, let's admit it, this is payback, Ava. You
wanted to hurt my little girl!

Mallet: Mr. Ditkins,
Springfield PD.
Ditkins: Is there a problem?

Mallet: No, no. Not at
all. I'm Detective Mallet. This is my partner, Detective Aitoro. We've been assigned to Jeffrey O’Neill’s campaign-- security detail.
Ditkins: Jeffrey O’Neill?

Gus: We know that he worked under you at the
agency.
Ditkins: What do you want?

Mallet: There's
been some questions that have been coming up about his past. And we wouldn't be
doing our job very well unless we made sure that nothing from his past comes
back and bites him in the...
Gus: Butt.
Mallet: Yeah.

Ditkins: Yeah. So O’Neill hasn't
dropped out of the race?
Gus: No, why, should he?
Ditkins: Yeah.
Mallet: Do you have something to tell us?

Ditkins: No. But how would you like to take a peek at his
confidential file?
Gus: Well, now, why would you do that?
Ditkins: Well, let's just say I owe Jeffrey.

Mallet: Sweet, man. He wilted under our
pressure.
Gus: We're good.
Mallet: We're good.
(Cell phone rings)
Jeffrey: O’Neill.

Ditkins: I hear you're still running for mayor. I thought I
made myself clear.
Jeffrey: I don't work for you anymore.

Ditkins: Suit yourself. Don't expect us to keep protecting
you. Politics is a... cut-throat business. A dirty
past is hard to hide.

Jeffrey: Don't threaten me. You have as much
to loose as I do.
Ditkins: Not necessarily.
Jeffrey: What's that supposed to mean?

Ditkins: A couple of Springfield’s
finest came snooping around today.
Jeffrey: Mallet?

Ditkins: Yeah, that's the guy. I'm about to send him your
file.
Jeffrey: You wouldn't dare.

Ditkins: Funny thing, though, the file makes no mention of us,
but it makes you look like a monster. Go figure.
Jeffrey: Excuse me, guys. Can I borrow her?
Dinah: Excuse me.

Jeffrey: The party's over. I've got a job
for you to do.
Dinah: What do you think I'm doing?
Jeffrey: Your boyfriend won't quit.

Dinah: If this is about Mallet, I don't want
to hear it.

Jeffrey: You don't have a choice. Your
boyfriend is about to get his hands on my personnel file.

Dinah: Personnel file? Which means what I
think it means?

Jeffrey: Yeah, and maybe more. I need to win
this election. Mallet cannot see that file.
Dinah: What do you want me to do about it?
Jeffrey: I want you to get it back.
Dinah: How?
Jeffrey: I don't care how. Find a way.

Dinah: No, no. I cannot see Mallet. I don't
want him in my sight. That's what works for me. This is your problem.

Jeffrey: This is our problem. If Mallet sees
that file and finds out the truth, your insurance policy goes out the window
because I won't be able to keep you out of prison anymore.
Rick: Excuse me.

Beth: Hey. I just needed to talk to you as a
friend.
Rick: What's going on?

Beth: Well, I've done something to try to
protect Lizzie.
Rick: What did you do?

Beth: I don't want Lizzie
to get hurt, but as long as she is anywhere near Jonathan Randall...
Rick: Beth, Jonathan Randall is the baby's father.
Beth: Don't remind me.

Rick: Beth, you've always made good
decisions when it comes to Lizzie.
Beth: I knew you could make me feel better.

Rick: You can always come to me, you know
that.
Beth: Look at you. (Laughs) Back on the job.
Rick: I know.

Beth: How does it feel to be back on the
job?

Rick: It feels so good. Olivia just came in
with Emma, and it felt so good to be able to help that
girl out.
Beth: Is she okay?

Rick: She's going to be fine. I feel like I
might be getting my job back together. --My life back together. I got my job,
and guess what? Mel told me she wants to rebuild our marriage. Isn't that
great?
Beth: A new beginning.
Rick: Yeah.
Beth: So is that with or without me?

Lizzie: How did you know? You're still
having me followed.
Alan: It doesn't have to be this way.
Lizzie: Well, then stop it!

Alan: I can’t. But
you can. All you have to do is come home where you belong. You don't want to
take this case to court.

Lizzie: I will do whatever it takes to keep
my baby safe from you. And if that means going to court, then I will go to
court.

Alan: Do you realize what the newspapers
will do, what the gossip columnists will do? They'll have a heyday with you.
They'll make out every bad choice you have made, and put it in the paper, and
they'll talk about your mental state. I do not want
you to suffer through that.

Lizzie: I am not crazy! I'm not! And as much
as you want to make it seem like I am, I will be a good mother!

Alan: Elizabeth, does a good mother go to
the roof of a hospital and threaten...
Lizzie: I never intended...

Alan: Does she lie to the father of her
baby? Does she shoot a gun at shadows on the floor?

Lizzie: No, no... You know why I did all of
those things.

Alan: I know why you told me you did, but
your behavior is questionable, sweetheart. A rational person doesn't do that.
Lizzie: You're rational?

Alan: We're not talking about my parenting
skill; we're talking about yours.

Lizzie: No, no. You want custody of my
child. Of course the judge is going to look at you, and look at the children
you raised.
Jonathan: She's got you there, Al.
Alan: Mr. Randall, father of the year.

Jonathan: Why don't you just leave her
alone? You know she's not going to do what you want.

Alan: Last chance, Elizabeth.
Come home with me and I will call the whole thing off.
Tammy: The answer is no.
Alan: See you in court.
Lizzie: I stood up to him. I tried.
Jonathan: I'm going to go try to find Mel. Hold up.

Alan: More threats, Mr.
Randall?

Jonathan: No. I agree with you. I don't want
things getting too far out of hand. So I want to make you a deal.
Alan: Well...

Kim Zimmer,
"Inside The Light."

I think the Lewis’
and the Spaulding’s, that's been destined to happen.
I'm very much looking forward to rubbing shoulders with Alan Spaulding again and Alexandra
and the rest of those crazy people.

See Reva,
Wednesday, August 30th, "Inside
The Light."

Jonathan: You know what, Al? All of the
trouble, the baby, it's all worth it, for one reason. I'm going to get my hands
on Lizzie’s money, and her body, too. I guess that is
two reasons.
Alan: You'll get nothing.

Jonathan: I'll definitely get her trust
fund, and you won't be around forever-- bad ticker,
and all-- and so probably I will get the mother load.

Alan: I can assure you, Mr.
Randall, you will not see one dime of Spaulding
money.

Jonathan: That's going to be hard to do from
the grave, old man. That's right, I'm a very patient man and I like to own
things. Something you and I have in common. But I don't have enough money to
buy a mansion or a small country, so I have to think of other ways.
Alan: You're making a big mistake.

Jonathan: I don't think so. Look at what I
have in my account, two hot chicks, Spaulding heir.
You know what, I think I'm going to bag your darling Elizabeth
a few more times, try for another Spaulding brat. (Grunts)

Dinah: I don't want to see Mallet. I can't
see Mallet.
Jeffrey: I feel for you.
Dinah: Oh, I bet you do.

Jeffrey: Okay, you can't be around Mallet.
Well, it's either that, sweetheart, or you go back to jail.
Dinah: You're full of sympathy.

Jeffrey: I am going to win this election. If
I go down, guess what? I'm taking you with me.

Dinah: Why don't you tell me how Mallet got his
hands on the file...

Jeffrey: It doesn't matter how he got it.
You need to get it back.
Dinah: Jeffrey, we have broken up.

Jeffrey: He wants to be your knight in
shining armor, so just let him. Use it.

Dinah: That is going to tear me apart, and
you know it.

Jeffrey: What do you think prison is going
to do to you?
Dinah: Well, this may be harder.

Beth: Rick, I know you feel guilty about
what we've been doing...
Rick: Beth, we're having an affair.

Beth: "Affair" is a trashy word.
We're comforting each other. Come on, with our history, it makes sense.

Rick: It makes sense? Beth, what are you
talking about? We're married to other people.

Beth: Well, I didn't marry for love, and I
certainly didn't marry for emotional support.

Rick: Well, Beth,
I did marry for love. And no matter how hard I try to get around it, I need
that emotional support. I need it.

Beth: All I know is how I feel and what I need. You know, Rick, this
situation with Lizzie could get ugly and I need you in my corner.

Rick: I need you. I
really need you and I’m feeling very guilty about that.

Beth: What, do you think I’m proud
of it? Do you think this is the life that I envisioned for myself? No. But I
have to make the best of it. I have to get by somehow. Isn't it the same for
you?

Rick: Yes. We need to get together and talk
about this.
Beth: Okay. Okay. Call me, then.
Olivia: So did you plan this?
Ava: What? I would never hurt a child.
Olivia: Just my child right?
Buzz: You’re in shock.

Olivia: I can’t lose her. Did you see her
lying in there helpless, the life breathing out of her? I can't lose her.
Buzz: She is going to be all right.

Olivia: You don't know that. No one knows
that. My mother died, Marisa, and now... Why do I keep
losing everybody I love?
Coop: She's just scared right now.

Ava: I know she's scared. I am, too. But why
does she keep saying those things to me? I would never intentionally hurt Emma. Never.

Coop: Stop, stop, ok. Olivia
just needs somebody to take
her anger out on, that's all. Look, I would never let
anyone hurt you.
(Knock on door)
Dinah: Remember me?

Mallet: Uh-huh, well, I
didn't expect to see you here.

Dinah: Yeah, I came by to talk about the
wedding cancellation stuff and I thought I would pick up a few things from our
room.

Mallet: Hmm. All our stuff burned up.
Remember? Fires tend to do that.

Dinah: Everything in the bathroom,
everything in the room, I mean... did anything make it in the move?

Mallet: Ha ha,
that's funny. I thought I was the only one coming up with lame excuses for us
to see each other.
Dinah: Oh, you have a lame excuse, too?
Mallet: I had a few.
Dinah: Really, like what?

Mallet: I was going to call you and see you
if you needed anything lifted or moved, like patio furniture or a baby grand
piano.

Dinah: That would be a problem since I don't
have a patio and I'm not musically inclined.

Mallet: I came up a whole bodyguard
scenario.

Dinah: Oh, you were going to offer to be my
bodyguard?

Mallet: Yeah, I thought it was plausible. I
figure if Kevin Costner
could do it. I'm no Kevin Costner,
and you're no Whitney Houston.
Dinah: No, can't sing.

Mallet: And I was actually going to memorize
lyrics to a love song. I was going to leave it your voicemail, and it beeped
and I panicked and hung up.

Dinah: There's like a theme going on here,
right?

Mallet: I'm kind of crazy missing you. So
what do you think? Do you think any of these ideas would have worked? Say
something.

Dinah: I don't have anything to say. I have
absolutely nothing to say.
Buzz: Here you go.
Ava: Thanks.
Buzz: It's going to be all right.
Coop: He's right.

Ava: I just keep praying she is going to be
okay.

Coop: She will be. Any moment Rick is going to come walking out that door and he is going
to tell us all of the good news.

Ava: Yeah. Do you want to come with me to
the chapel? I think Emma could use as many good
thoughts as she can get.
Coop: Sure. Come on.
Buzz: Light a candle for me, too, okay?

Olivia: It won't make a difference. If I
love somebody, they get taken away.
Buzz: No one is going to die.

Olivia: Emma's in there because I'm a bad
person, because I've done horrible things in my life. I'm being punished.
Buzz: You're not being punished.
Olivia: I am. Just like with my mother.

Buzz: Don't blame yourself. Don’t. It's not going to help your daughter. You have to
believe in yourself and have faith in yourself. Because if
you falter, she'll feel it.
Olivia: I can’t.

Buzz: You've got to be strong. You've got to
have all of the will that she has. Okay?
Olivia: Okay. Hey.

Rick: Hey. You can go see your little girl
now.

Olivia: Hey. Mommy's here, sweetie. Mommy's
here.
Alan: I will keep you away from Elizabeth and our baby at all costs.

Jonathan: I am flesh and blood with her. You
can't say the same thing. You will never see your granddaughter, not once. How
does it feel to know you're going to be completely shut out of her life?
Alan: I see what you're doing.
Tammy: Jonathan.

Lizzie: Oh, my God, Granddad, what are you
doing?

Alan: Nothing, absolutely nothing. Nice try,
Mr. Randall. Gus, did you have reason to believe there
was going to be some trouble here?
Gus: I don't know. It crossed my mind.
Alan: I will see you soon, Elizabeth.
Jonathan: What are you guys doing here?

Tammy: I saw Mel.
We figured out you must have gone after Alan.
Lizzie: Were you guys fighting?
Jonathan: Well...
Gus: It is an oldie but a goodie, right, Jonathan?
Jonathan: Yeah, spur of the moment.
Lizzie: I don't get it.

Gus: See, Jonathan
would want to get grandpa all riled up, and he would throw himself off the
balcony, making grandpa look like a psycho.

Jonathan: And it would have worked, too if
it weren't for you meddling kids. He was this close.

Gus: I know you are desperate, but you are
going about it all wrong.

Lizzie: Maybe you tell us what
is the right way to go about it, because I can't lose my baby?

Gus: First thing you need to do is call Mel,
because you are gonna need a good lawyer.

Tammy: Do you really think that it is that
bad?

Gus: At this stage of the game, I'm thinking
it would be better if there were real bullets in that gun instead of blanks.

Jonathan: So you're saying we're completely
screwed?

Olivia: You have a dance recital coming up.
You've been excited about it all week. You don't have time to be sick in the
hospital. And we have a sleepover at Cindy’s on Saturday. Remember? We're going to take popsicles. Maybe it's better you rest. Can you sit with her for a minute? I
have to ask Rick something.
Buzz: I'm not going anywhere.
Ava: Is she okay?

Jeffrey: Dinah, where are you? I should have
heard back from you by now. I hope that means that operation “do whatever it
takes” is under way. You've got to get that file, Dinah,
or even Mallet won't be able to help you.

Dinah: Okay. I knew this was going to
happen.
Mallet: What?
Dinah: Just don't talk. Don't talk.
Alan: Soon, baby, very soon.

Gus: All right, no more stupid people
tricks. Walk me out.
Lizzie: All right.

Gus: I want you to know that you're not
alone, okay?

Lizzie: Then why do I feel so alone, except
for Jonathan and Tammy?

Gus: Because you're all caught up in this
fight. And grandpa, he zaps all your energy. I've been there. I know it is not
a great place to be. More importantly, you all right?
Lizzie: Yeah.
Gus: The baby?
Lizzie: The baby is great.

Gus: Yeah, let's keep it that way. I was
thinking, if you want I can
hide you some place until you have the baby, so you don't have to deal with all
of this.

Lizzie: Thanks, but Jonathan’s
got to be a part of this.

Gus: Okay. If you change
your mind...
Lizzie: Okay. Thank you.

Jonathan: Alan is going to kill Lizzie on the stand. He won't stop until he gets what he
wants.
Tammy: What do you want to do?
Jonathan: Do you trust me?
Tammy: Of course I trust you.

Jonathan: I promise I'll give you the life
you deserve, but right now I've got to protect my kid. We have to leave. It's
the only way.
Tammy: Then we'll leave.
Lizzie: What are you doing?

Jonathan: The three of us are leaving. We're
going to beat Alan at his own game. You
in?
Lizzie: Yeah, sure. Are we coming back?

Jonathan: Eventually. But not right now. You
can't have that baby here. You have to have that baby in peace. No crazy stuff,
and no crazy Alan.
Lizzie: The four of us?
Jonathan: Huh?

Lizzie: You said the three of us were taking
off, but we're four now.
Next on "Guiding Light"...

Mallet: I don't know what made
you come knock on my door, but even if it's for one
